Expectation1: Live according to Christian moral values and ethics
Situation1: They try to keep moral values in mind during everyday routines
Expectation2: Follow the instructions and guidelines provided by the volunteer coordinator
Situation2: The coordinator emailed a brief suggestion about organizing supplies a different way if time allows.
Story: I arrived early at the community center, ready to help with the food pantry as I do every Saturday. As a Christian, I always try to treat everyone with kindness and honesty, making sure my actions reflect my faith. Today, the volunteer coordinator sent an email suggesting we reorganize the supply shelves if we had extra time, even though it would mean moving some items that were already set aside for families in need. The new system would make things more efficient, but I worried it might confuse the families who rely on finding their usual items in the same place. I felt torn—on one hand, I wanted to follow the coordinator’s instructions and be a good volunteer, but on the other, I questioned if it was right to disrupt the routine for those who already have so little stability. My heart ached as I stood in front of the shelves, wrestling with the expectations of my faith and my responsibility as a volunteer, unsure which path would truly serve others best.
